english_translation: First Chain: Narrated from 'Amir (al-Sha'bi) that a man who sat with Masruq used to know his face but not call him by name. He accompanied him and was the last to bid him farewell. He said: Indeed you are the pride of the Quran reciters and their chief, your honor is their honor and your shame is their shame, so do not suggest to yourself poverty or long life. Second Chain: Narrated by Ibn 'Uyaynah from Ibrahim ibn Muhammad ibn al-Muntashir from his father: Masruq and his wife loved that one of them would go to the Euphrates, fetch a skin of water, sell it, and give the price in charity. Third Chain: Narrated by al-Fadl ibn Dukain from Hafs from al-A'mash from Abu al-Duhha from Masruq: He bought a ram and sacrificed it, and its owner would come to him saying: Give us something, bring us something.
